TowarzyszÄ… temu klimatyczne wokale oraz niecodzienne instrumenty z dawno minionej epoki, takie jak sÅ‚owiaÅ„ska harfa (gusli), lira korbowa i wiele innych. Formacja w 2023 roku wydaÅ‚a swÃ³j debiutancki album zatytuÅ‚owany â€œGorejâ€. Obecnie jej czÅ‚onkowie nagrywajÄ… nowÄ… pÅ‚ytÄ™, wspÃ³Å‚pracujÄ…c z Paprodziadem. Niedawno ukazaÅ‚ siÄ™ singiel â€œRodu Rootâ€ zwiastujÄ…cy nowy krÄ…Å¼ek.    Echo Rodu was born in the depths of mountain wilderness, where harmonious vibrations carry the sounds of organic melodies. It is a fusion of traditional Slavic folklore and tribal rhythms with modern influencesâ€”diverse electronic sounds inspired by the voices of wild forests. Accompanying this are atmospheric vocals and rare instruments from a long-gone era, such as the Slavic harp (gusli), hurdy-gurdy, and many others.  Drawing from genres like organic downtempo, neotribal, psytrance, and folktronica, the band's music immerses listeners in ancient rituals and sweeps them into trance-like dances.  In 2023, the group released their debut album, Gorej. Currently, its members are working on a new record in collaboration with Paprodziad. Recently, they released the single Rodu Root, heralding the upcoming album.

ENGLISH BELOW    DZIWOLUDY to WrocÅ‚awski zespÃ³Å‚ istniejÄ…cy od 2014r, ktÃ³ry okreÅ›la swÃ³j gatunek muzyczny jako 'folk Å›redniowieczny'. Brzmi dziwnie? To dobrze. Na pewno nie jest to muzyka dawna, kojarzona z renesansem, ani ta ludowa, world ethno, czy tzw. muzyka archaiczna. ZespÃ³Å‚ opiera siÄ™ na oryginalnych melodiach Å›redniowiecznych, aranÅ¼ujÄ…c je folkowo, tak by byÅ‚o ciekawie i z odpowiedniÄ… energiÄ….W tym celu DZIWOLUDY uÅ¼ywajÄ… jedynie akustycznych instrumentÃ³w tradycyjnychtakich jak panduri, saz, viella, kemenche i baraban. Wszystkie je moÅ¼na usÅ‚yszeÄ‡ na koncercie i oceniÄ‡ ile dÅºwiÄ™ku da siÄ™ z nich wykrzesaÄ‡. A na liÅ›cie utworÃ³w znajdÄ… siÄ™ stare pieÅ›ni sÅ‚owiaÅ„skie, melodie ze Skandynawii, Germanii, Rusi, taÅ„ce z Bretonii i poÅ‚udnia Europy. Innymi sÅ‚owy takie hity wszechczasÃ³w, ktÃ³rych nie usÅ‚yszycie w Å¼adnym radiu.    The idea dawned in the head of a certain Szuwar from WrocÅ‚aw, when around 2014, he wandered around tournaments and rallies with a group of early medieval performers. Several musicians, brave enough to give up their modern habits, answered his call. And so the metal guitarist switched to the 3 string panduri, his bandmate got the saz, the jazzbassist critically looked at the wooden flute, the rock drummer learned that he was to play the baraban, the classical violinist uncertainly took kemenche bow, and the experienced singer was sent back to the first white singing lessons. Oh, it was not easy. Especially, if you mention that in the selection of repertoires they still had to work tediously through historical sources and the depths of the Internet. The whole undertaking rightly deserves the name 'Dziwoludy'. Now in their Middle Ages, they found their own sound, which they would like to share.

Ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs are certainly one of the most intriguing elements of the ancient Egyptian civilisation, frequently appearing in the products of modern popular culture, including films and TV series. In these cases, the alleged hieroglyphic inscriptions do not make sense, as their primary task is to give an Egyptian flavour to the plot. But how do hieroglyphs actually work? What language was written with them? Is it possible to write down anything we want using hieroglyphs? If you want to know the answer, this is a perfect lecture for you.
